zero_apply:
/- Register simplification lemmas for the applications of `pi_Lp` elements, as the usual lemmas
for Pi types will not trigger. -/
@[simp]
theorem zero_apply : (0 : pi_Lp p β) i = 0 :=
  rfl
#align zero_apply zero_apply

/-- An auxiliary lemma used twice in the proof of `pi_Lp.pseudo_metric_aux` below. Not intended for
use outside this file. -/
theorem supr_edist_ne_top_aux {ι : Type _} [Finite ι] {α : ι → Type _} [∀ i, pseudo_metric_space (α i)]
    (f g : pi_Lp (ennreal.top) α) :
    «expr⨆ , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr⨆ , »"
        (edist (f i) (g i)) ≠
      «expr⊤» :=
  by
  cases nonempty_fintype ι
  obtain ⟨M, hM⟩ := fintype.exists_le fun i => (⟨dist (f i) (g i), dist_nonneg⟩ : nnreal)
  refine' ne_of_lt ((supᵢ_le fun i => _).trans_lt (@ennreal.coe_lt_top M))
  simp only [edist, pseudo_metric_space.edist_dist, ennreal.of_real_eq_coe_nnreal dist_nonneg]
  exact_mod_cast hM i
#align supr_edist_ne_top_aux supr_edist_ne_top_aux
sub_apply:
@[simp]
theorem sub_apply : (x - y) i = x i - y i :=
  rfl
#align sub_apply sub_apply

/-- This holds independent of `p` and does not require `[fact (1 ≤ p)]`. We keep it separate

  by

  · simp [edist_eq_card]
  · simp [edist_eq_supr]
  · simp [edist_eq_sum h, ennreal.zero_rpow_of_pos h, ennreal.zero_rpow_of_pos (inv_pos.2 <| h)]

/-- This holds independent of `p` and does not require `[fact (1 ≤ p)]`. We keep it separate

    matrix.mul (b.to_matrix (pi_Lp.basis_fun _ _ _)) A =

  exact this

theorem aux_uniformity_eq : (uniformity) (pi_Lp p β) = @uniformity _ (Pi.uniform_space _) :=
  by

  rw [← A.comap_uniformity, this, comap_id]

    _ = _ := comap_id
